officers.title: President
officers.name: Ethyn Bazzeghin
officers.bio: Ethyn Bazzeghin is in his second year at CSU pursuing a major in trumpet performance. This will be Ethyn’s first year as president of the trumpet guild. Ethyn has been pursuing trumpet since 6th grade and has been apart of multiple ensembles at CSU including Symphonic Band, Jazz 2, A Brass Quintet, Baroque Trumpet Ensemble, Trumpet Quartet, Marching Band and Pep Band. Ethyn is striving to become a part of a military band or major orchestra.  In his off time he likes to  play Pickleball, Wiffleball, Minecraft, watch movies, play games, hang out with friends and to make music with others.

officers.title: Vice President
officers.name: Kris Usrey
officers.bio: Kris Usrey is currently in his 4th year at Colorado State University pursuing a double major in trumpet performance and psychology. This is his first year serving as vice president for the university’s ITG chapter. During his time at CSU, he has worked on the creation and editing of all state instructional videos, performed multiple solos in front of the school of music, and even directed a documentary revolving around the CSU trumpet studio. In his free time, you’ll find Kris playing Polka music, creating YouTube videos, and watching the Denver Broncos.

officers.title: Treasurer
officers.name: Alex Gregory
officers.bio: Alex Gregory is a first-year music education student and trumpet player at Colorado State University, and this is their first term as an officer of the CSU International Trumpet Guild chapter. A Denver native, they served as the Greater Boulder Youth Orchestra Principal trumpet from 2020 to 2023. They have played hundreds of performances in many different ensembles, including full baroque orchestra, jazz combinations, wind ensembles, and original compositional premieres. In addition to college, Alex spends their summers competing in Drum Corps International. Most recently, they were recognized as a Rookie of the Year for their trumpet performance contract in the 2023 Blue Knights Drum & Bugle Corps hornline.

officers.title: Secratary
officers.name: Liv Caskey
officers.bio: Liv Caskey is a sophomore at Colorado State University studying trumpet performance. Liv has been studying trumpet since fifth grade. In high school she was part of was a part of jazz, pep, concert, and marching band, and was also a drum major. Liv is an avid jazz lover and is now a member of Jazz 1 Big Band and a jazz combo at CSU. She is also a part of symphonic band, plays concert orchestra in cello, and sings in chamber choir. Liv hopes to be a part of a traveling symphony or jazz house band one day. Outside of playing the trumpet, Liv likes to climb, ski, and read.

officers.title: Faculty Advisor
officers.name: Dr. Stanley Curtis
officers.bio: Stanley Curtis has developed a career as a trumpeter, teacher, composer and early-music performer. After studying at the University of Alabama, the Cleveland Institute of Music and in the Netherlands on a Fulbright Scholarship, he received his Doctor of Music from Indiana University in 2005. In 1996, he won third prize in the ITG Altenburg International Baroque Trumpet Competition. He has taught at George Mason University and served as Historic Trumpet Division chair of the National Trumpet Competition. Having retired from a 20-year career in the U.S. Navy Band in Washington, D.C., he was appointed trumpet professor at Colorado State University in 2018. In 2022 he became President of the Historic Brass Society. Stanley blogs on his own Trumpet Journey website.
